channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: APO Hosting Welcome Dinner September 13
item.description: Date: Friday, September 13, 2024 6:00 PM - 9:00 PM - Students who are interested in joining APO and becoming a member are welcome to attend this potluck event!
item.author: Students

item.title: CEE Hosting Ice Cream Social September 11
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 11, 2024 3:00 PM - 5:00 PM - All Civil, Environmental, and undeclared Engineering students are invited to CEE’s Ice Cream Social, featuring make-your-own sundaes, games, prizes and fun!!! Please RSVP if you plan to attend.
item.author: Students

item.title: Sign-Ups for September 11 CCPD Fall Resumania Still Available!
item.description: Join CCPD for the Fall 2024 Resumania, which will take place from noon to 3:00PM on Wednesday, September 11. During this event, students will have the opportunity to have their resume reviewed by employers or career counseling staff for a 15-minute segment, so sign up for your 15-minute time slot today!
item.author: Students

item.title: Discounted Adobe Creative Cloud Subscriptions Available for Students
item.description: DotCIO will be offering Students an option to purchase Adobe Creative Cloud through Rensselaer at a significant discount over Adobe’s normal student pricing. Pricing is as posted and subject to change at any time. Currently licenses purchased through Rensselaer will cost $110 and will be valid from activation through the following summer term or until you are no longer an active Rensselaer student, whichever comes first. Please view the full announcement for details.
item.author: Students

item.title: iEar Presents Guest Speaker Oron Catts
item.description: This talk with Oron Catts will explore and unpack artistic projects that deals with the ways current applications of biological knowledge confuse our cultural understanding and relationships with the concepts of life, nature and land. Join us at 5pm-6:30pm on September 10 in the CBIS Auditorium.
item.author: Community

item.title: NYS Pollution Prevention Institute Student and Faculty Research Symposium Scheduled for September 20
item.description: Date: Friday, September 20, 2024 9:30 AM - 3:30 PM - Chemical and Biological Engineering is hosting the Second Annual NYS2PI Student and Faculty Research Program Symposium highlighting “Reagents of Change: Green Chemistry and Safer Chemicals in Products and Industry.” The program includes keynote speakers, student-led project presentations and a poster session, and breakfast and lunch. Register by September 16!
item.author: Community

item.title: Lee, Tao Bringing “Feedback” to EMPAC
item.description: Date: Friday, September 13, 2024 7:00 PM - Join EMPAC for Feedback, a concert of charged electro-acoustic music by Charmaine Lee and Conrad Tao, two composer-performers who combine spontaneity and playfulness with virtuosic and rigorous musicianship to create an energetic and hyper-sensorial world of electronic sounds and voice spanning a range of genres. Surrounded by a battery of various instruments, the duo will debut new material designed especially for EMPAC Studio 1—Goodman.
item.author: Community

item.title: Multimedia Services Announces Reauthentication Requirement for Webex
item.description: Starting on Monday, September 23, all Webex applications (desktop or mobile) will require reauthentication every 30 days. Please allow extra time when launching the application to confirm that it is properly authenticated prior to any meeting. This will improve security and ensure the software is updated.
item.author: Community

item.title: Help Ensure the Upcoming Reunion & Homecoming is a Success!
item.description: Institute Advancement | The Office of Alumni Engagement is looking for assistance/volunteers during Reunion & Homecoming weekend from Friday, September 27 – Sunday, September 29, 2024. Visit the Reunion & Homecoming SignUp page to view opportunities and to select the time slots that work for you; training will begin the week of September 16. Your participation will help ensure that our alumni and guests have a great weekend!
item.author: Community

item.title: MBA for Professionals Review to be Held September 11
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 11, 2024 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM - Register to join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D., as he reviews this innovative project-based, online MBA for professionals program. Participants will learn to lead from every aspect of an organization with real-world MBA experience, prepare to lead the most dynamic and innovative organizations, and engage, involve, motivate, and lead others to reach their fullest potential.
item.author: Community

item.title: Faculty/Staff In-Person Workshop to Offer Beta Classroom “Teaching with Technology” Preview
item.description: Date: Tuesday, September 17, 2024 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM - Join the Office of Undergraduate Education’s Maureen Fodera as she discusses Folsom Library’s collaboratory space and the technologies that are available in its Beta Classroom, a high-technology testing space for interactive learning that allows faculty to pilot new, interactive technologies and pedagogical approaches they can recommend for other classrooms. Please register by September 12.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: “Creating Basic Pivot Tables with Excel for Windows” Topic of Fac/Staff Quick Learn Webinar
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 10:30 AM - 11:00 AM - If you’re an instructor or staff member who works with data in Excel and you’re always manipulating the content with filters and sorting, Pivot Tables in Excel might be for you! Register to join Office of Undergraduate Education’s Maureen Fodera as she discusses using Pivot Tables to work with data, apply basic functions, and include charts.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Workshop: “Leading Virtually”
item.description: Virtual and remote work creates both challenges and opportunities to work as a cohesive team focused on achieving results. This seminar explores the fundamentals of Rensselaer’s Flexible Work Program, teaches leaders how to communicate more effectively in a virtual environment, focus their team by keeping team members and their goals visible and in sight and enhance trust among members separated by time and/or distance.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Multimedia Services Announces Mediasite Capture Now Available to Faculty, Staff
item.description:
Multimedia Services is pleased to announce that Mediasite Capture is now available to staff and faculty through MyMediasite. Capture allows recording of video through a browser without installing any additional software. Please refer to ITSSC for more information on Mediasite Capture.
